bas#. . . . . . . . . .   0.0   (0.0-0.1) th/cumm

amylase . . . . . . .   <30      (30-110)       u/l
lipase. . . . . . . . .  40      (23-300)       u/l
cholecystectomy
real time grey scale sonographic images demonstrate a lobular echogenic lesion within the  the gallbladder measuring 1.9 x 1.0 cm.  the gallbladder demonstrates a 2.6 cm stone in the neck which did not change in position.  gall bladder wall thickening and pericholecystic fluid was present (not pictured).  a positive sonographic murphy’s sign was present.  no intrahepatic or common ductal dilatation was present.
acute cholecystitis with cholelithiasis
and no soft tissue mass
acute cholecystitis and

intraluminal soft tissue mass:
sludge
benign or malignant polyp
hematoma
fungus ball
52 year old woman with unrelenting right upper quadrant pain in the emergency department with a positive murphy’s sign.
it is not uncommon to have sonographic findings of two conditions.  the patient clinically had acute cholecystitis; however, an additional finding was present in the gall bladder.  a soft tissue mass within the gall bladder such as this presentation made the possibility of a benign or malignant neoplasm possible.  other considerations in this case were hematoma, fungal infection, and most likely sludge.  pathology demonstrated no mass.
